001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.encoder;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.AnalogInput;
004import com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.Sensor;
005
006/**
007 * A wrapper around an AnalogInput that enables "zeroing" for usefulness
008 */
009public class ExternalEncoder extends Sensor<AnalogInput> implements Encoder {
010
011    private double zero = 0;
012
013    /**
014     * Create an ExternalEncoder from an arbitrary AnalogInput
015     *
016     * @param device the AnalogInput device
017     */
018    public ExternalEncoder(AnalogInput device) {
019        super(device);
020    }
021
022    /**
023     * Create an ExternalEncoder from an arbitrary AnalogInput device
024     *
025     * @param deviceName the name of the AnalogInput device
026     */
027    public ExternalEncoder(String deviceName) {
028        super(deviceName);
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * Set the current device value as "zero"
033     */
034    @Override
035    public void zeroEncoder() {
036        zero = getDevice().getVoltage();
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Get the sensor value (relative to the assigned zero)
041     *
042     * @return the value of the input
043     */
044    @Override
045    public double getSensorValue() {
046        return getDevice().getVoltage() - zero;
047    }
048}
